alert.note: Alert for Norfolk; Suffolk (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 4:43AM EST until December 19 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Massachusetts...Connecticut... Connecticut River At Montague affecting Franklin and Hampshire Counties. Connecticut River At Thompsonville affecting Hampden and Hartford Counties. Connecticut River At Northampton affecting Hampshire and Hampden Counties. Connecticut River At Middle Haddam affecting Middlesex County. Neponset River At Norwood affecting Suffolk and Norfolk Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Connecticut... Farmington River At Simsbury affecting Hartford County. Connecticut River At Hartford affecting Middlesex and Hartford Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Connecticut River Below Holyoke affecting Hampden County. For the Connecticut River...including Montague, Northampton, Holyoke Dam, Holyoke, Springfield, Thompsonville, Hartford, Middle Haddam... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Farmington River...including Unionville, Simsbury, Tariffville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Neponset River...including Norwood...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Neponset River at Norwood. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding occurs along the Neponset River in Norwood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 9.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:00 AM EST Tuesday was 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 7.6 feet early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.9 feet on 12/27/1969. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued early this morning at 545 AM EST.
